msbt.message: Imagine being attacked by a Deinonychus like this Those sharp claws are scary!
I wonder if this Megaloceros would get its antlers snagged on trees if it tried to run through the woods?
I'm glad we don't have any of these flying around overhead these days.
Be honest I wouldn't be able to outrun a T. Rex if it started chasing after me, would I?
They don't really know why it had those plates on its back, but I like the idea that they were for show. I think it's funny to think that there might have been a show-off dinosaur!
The Brachiosaurus was huge! It must have had to eat tons of food! I don't think I'd want to have to feed one.
If Mammoths were still around, do you think they'd mind if we wanted to find out what their fur felt like?
The oceans must have been so strange when creatures like this were still around to swim in them.
I've read that the eusthenopteron had fins that were almost sturdy enough to walk with up on land.
They think this was one of the first kinds of fish that had jaws. All the better to EAT you with! Pretty scary
How could something as big as this Quetzalcoatlus ever stay in the air?
Fossils like this can probably reveal a lot about prehistoric diets, butIt's tough to imagine handling and studying these with a straight face.
They think these juramaia were around at the same time as the last of the dinosaursThey must've had to run fast to avoid being stepped on!
This fossil was donated by you, right? Thanks so much for that!
I can trace my ancestry all the way back to this branch of the tree of life. So eerie,
